text: Config file contains a set of values that determine how file(s) are processed. Creating a config file is not necessary. Splix will apply a recommended configuration automatically, but sometimes this may cause problems, or you might want to tune the output.
export_mode determines if Splix should create a new output directory for encoded file(s). The default value is 0, which indicates that a new directory aex_export_YY_MM_DD will be created.

cmd: export_dir allows the user to set a custom output directory. If the directory does not exist, Splix will create a new directory in the specified path.
backup_mode defines if original file(s) should be saved. Default value is 1, which indicates that a new directory aex_backup_YY_MM_DD will be created.
backup_dir will allow the user to set a custom backup directory. Invalid directory values will be ignored. If backup mode is set to false, this will be ignored as well.
auto_match_top determines if Splix should automatically detect overlapping lines. Overlapping lines will be set to the top of the screen. It is recommended to leave this setting to true.
remove_long_line will determine if lines containing too many characters should be removed. The default value is 0 which means that long lines are allowed.

overwrite_mode will define the mode used to determine if existing files should be overwritten. The values can set to: auto: prompt user to choose, overwrite: automatically overwrites existing files, ignore: does not overwrite files. If multiplexing mode is set to fast the overwriting mode auto is not viable, and will be set to ignore.

removal_keyword is an [regex](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_expression) string value, and will match lines containing the value. If this expression matches a line, then the line will be removed. In this example, matches would be splix and Splix.

sync_buffer is an integer value, and determines the time in milliseconds to be added or subtracted from each line. In this example each line will gain 1 second to their timecode. Original: 00:01:02,700 output: 00:01:03,700. Values can be positive or negative. If the value was -1000 then output: 00:01:01,700. Values 0, and aex_ignore will be ignored. The value can be preceeded with a timecode, which determines when syncing will start, e.g 00:15:45,-1000.

line_tuning determines the quality check tuning language. In this example ja indicates original content language and en the subtitle language. Splix has tuning configurations for Japanese content: ja_ja and ja_en. Tuning should be set to none if content language is not Japanese.

force_line_break determines if Splix should break long lines automatically. The line The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog, would be broken as follows: The quick brown foxjumps over the lazy dog.
